title: Transitions
description: Apply transitions between pages and layouts with Vue or native browser View Transitions.

children.value: component to apply transitions between pages and layouts.
You can enable page transitions to apply an automatic transition for all your

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp

children.value: on an individual page. Only JSON-serializable values are allowed.
If you are changing layouts as well as page, the page transition you set here will not run. Instead, you should set a
To start adding transition between your pages, add the following CSS to your

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<template>
  <NuxtPage />
</template>

<style>
.page-enter-active,
.page-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.page-enter-from,
.page-leave-to {
  opacity: 0;
  filter: blur(1rem);
}
</style>

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

To set a different transition for a page, set the

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
definePageMeta({

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<template>
  <NuxtPage />
</template>

<style>
/* ... */
.rotate-enter-active,
.rotate-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.rotate-enter-from,
.rotate-leave-to {
  opacity: 0;
  transform: rotate3d(1, 1, 1, 15deg);
}
</style>

You can enable layout transitions to apply an automatic transition for all your

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp

children.value: on an individual page. Only JSON-serializable values are allowed.
To start adding transition between your pages and layouts, add the following CSS to your

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
<template>
  <NuxtLayout>
    <NuxtPage />
  </NuxtLayout>
</template>

<style>
.layout-enter-active,
.layout-leave-active {
  transition: all 0.4s;
}
.layout-enter-from,
.layout-leave-to {
  filter: grayscale(1);
}
</style>

To override the global transition property, use the
to define page or layout transitions for a single Nuxt page and override any page or layout transitions that are defined globally in

on an individual page. Only JSON-serializable values are allowed.
For advanced use-cases, you can use JavaScript hooks to create highly dynamic and custom transitions for your Nuxt pages.
This way presents perfect use-cases for JavaScript animation libraries such as

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
definePageMeta({
  pageTransition: {
    name: 'custom-flip',
    mode: 'out-in',
    onBeforeEnter: (el) => {
      console.log('Before enter...')
    },
    onEnter: (el, done) => {},
    onAfterEnter: (el) => {}
  }
})
</script>

Nuxt ships with an experimental implementation of the
). This is an exciting new way to implement native browser transitions which (among other things) have the ability to transition between unrelated elements on different pages.
You can check a demo on
The Nuxt integration is under active development, but can be enabled with the

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp

children.value: Enable View Transition API integration with client-side router.
If set to true, Nuxt will not apply transitions if the user's browser matches
, Nuxt will always apply the transition and it is up to you to respect the user's preference.
By default, view transitions are enabled for all
, but you can set a different global default.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp

children.value: // Disable view transitions globally, and opt-in on a per page basis
This only has an effect when
It is possible to override the default
value for a page by setting the

props.className: language-vue shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight twoslash lsp
props.code:
<script setup lang="ts">
definePageMeta({
  viewTransition: false
})
</script>

children.value: View transitions may not work as expected with nested pages/layouts/async components owing to this upstream Vue bug:
. If you make use of this pattern, you may need to delay adopting this experimental feature or implement it yourself. Feedback is very welcome.

If you perform data fetching within your page setup functions, that you may wish to reconsider using this feature for the moment. (By design, View Transitions completely freeze DOM updates whilst they are taking place.) We're looking at restrict the View Transition to the final moments before
resolves, but in the interim you may want to consider carefully whether to adopt this feature if this describes you.

html .light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html.light .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-light);background: var(--shiki-light-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-light-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-light-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-light-text-decoration);}html .default .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-default);background: var(--shiki-default-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-default-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-default-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-default-text-decoration);}html .dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}html.dark .shiki span {color: var(--shiki-dark);background: var(--shiki-dark-bg);font-style: var(--shiki-dark-font-style);font-weight: var(--shiki-dark-font-weight);text-decoration: var(--shiki-dark-text-decoration);}
